snippet: Poised to open in January, the Museum of the Second World War in Gdansk has become a political and cultural battlefield, pitting historians against a conservative government....
abstract: Museum of the Second World War in Gdansk, Poland, set to open in January 2017, is latest battleground in country's cultural and political wars; conservative culture minister Piotr Glinski wants to narrow institution's focus to Polish experience and Battle of Westerplatte, move many see as government attempt to rewrite history and portray country as perpetual noble victim.

byline.contributor: Joanna Berendt contributed reporting from Warsaw

lead_paragraph: Poised to open in January, the Museum of the Second World War in Gdansk has become a political and cultural battlefield, pitting historians against a conservative government.

headline.main: A Museum Becomes a Battlefield Over Poland’s History
headline.print_headline: What Poland Did in the War

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Museum of the Second World War
